scientists have joined these individual 30 to 60 mile ( 50 to 100km ) wide strips to create a single complete 3d map .  the new map allows astronomers to ' stand ' on planetary surfaces and could help explain how water and lava once flowed across the red planet .  the first mosaic , pieced together by the german aerospace center , comprises 1 . 4 million square miles ( 2 . 3 million square km ) of the surface .

researchers in massachusetts believe a person ' s keystrokes may reveal a huge amount of information about their motor skills .  the brain ' s primary motor cortex sends signals through several other brain regions , including the supplementary motor area , cerebellum , and basal ganglia .  these brain areas activate spinal neurons that stimulate muscles to execute the movement .  many factors can interfere with motor ability , including sleep deprivation .

the $ 40 ( £26 ) cloth cover is said to hydrate the face and prevent lines while you sleep .  unlike a normal cotton pillowcase , it apparently sucks moisture from the skin , leaving the face dry and dull .  the wrinkle preventing pillowcase ' s special blend of ' hydrophobic fibres ' keeps the complexion moistureted all night .

study analysed dna from 21 , 566 men convicted of sex offences in sweden between 1973 and 2009 .  found sons and brothers of convicted sex offenders more likely than average to commit similar crimes than men in the general population .  in only 2 per cent of cases could this familial connection be explained by shared environmental factors .

tracks left by a barefooted early human in ileret , kenya , have now been found .  they are the oldest human footprints left behind on a muddy lake shore .  researchers believe they belong to groups who all passed over the soft mud at the same time - perhaps stalking some of the other animals whose prints would have allowed them to hurl sticks and rocks at potential prey .  researchers hope to test their conclusions by studying the movement patterns of modern day subsistence hunters in africa .

gruesome death rituals performed 1 , 200 years ago have been uncovered in dozens of tombs in peru ' s cotahuasi valley .  each tomb was filled with bones of up to 60 mummies , with infants kept in small containers , and others ripped to pieces while decomposing .  archaeologists have so far opened up seven of the tombs , recovering 171 broken mummies from the ancient ceremonial site known as tenahaha .
plane carrying 59 passengers and eight crew members touched down in khajuraho .  crew ordered an evacuation after the boeing 737 - 800 came to a stop .  passengers spotted smoke outside the plane ' s left wing landing gear .  jet airways said reports of a fire are untrue .

alan turing wrote the notes at the bletchley park code - breaking headquarters in 1942 and paved the way for computer science .  it is believed to be the only extensive turing manuscript known to exist , auctioneer said .  pages of notes show the inner workings of turing ' s thoughts as he helped break codes and decipher tests .  but he kept the notebook , using its blank pages for writing down his dreams at the request of his psychiatrist .

noise - induced hearing loss is one of the most common work - related illnesses .  scientists at the university of southern california believe they have made a breakthrough in their understanding of the condition .  they have identified a gene , named nox3 , found in the inner ear , that is crucial in determining how vulnerable a person is to developing hearing loss .

the maglev train completed a test run on a track in yamanashi , beating the previous record of 361mph ( 580km / h ) set in 2003 .  it was able to go so fast because it made use of a magnetic charge to lift and move it above a guideway .  this eliminates the need for wheels and therefore any incidence of friction , providing a faster and quieter service .  the new line between tokyo and nagoya comes into service in 2027 .

research led by the university of montana has found that eating fast food after a workout may be just as beneficial as dietary supplements .  researchers found that during recovery periods of exercise , it didn ’ t matter what food was eaten .  performance remained the same after resting for several hours , while levels of glycogen were actually slightly higher .  just eight minutes of high - intensity cycling was found to be more beneficial than going at a moderate pace for 25 minutes - the current recommended level .

around 1 . 3 billion chinese people marked the qingming festival , a three - day holiday in china .  families descended on graveyards to clean their tombs of the deceased and honour their loved ones .  the ' yellow emperor ' huang di , considered the founding father of the chinese nation , ascended into heaven on the back of a dragon .  the festival falls in the first week of april every year and is one of the 24 chinese solar terms .

the dragon king dinosaur skull is being sold by hong kong - based experts evolve .  it is more than 95 per cent complete bone , is 9 . 2ft ( 2 . 8 metres ) high and 4 . 6ft ( 1 . 4 metres ) wide .  last time something of this size and quality came to market was when a tyrannosaurus rex fossil named ' sue ' was sold for £5 . 6 million ( $ 8 . 5 million ) in 1997 .

a silicon valley - based start - up is offering an at - home dna test to detect the same gene mutations priced at just $ 249 ( £167 ) it tests for mutations in brca1 and brca2 , along with 17 other markers , all of which are linked to an increased risk of breast and ovarian cancer .  the company behind the test , color genomics , was founded by elad gil , a former cancer researcher at mit and otman laraki .

carriers of the brca1 gene , like hollywood star angelina jolie , can reduce their risk of dying from breast cancer by more than 60 per cent .  if diagnosed , they face a life - time risk of breast cancer of up to 70 per cent if diagnosed with breast cancer .  researchers in canada analysed 676 breast cancer patients who had one of the mutated genes , nearly half ( 345 ) underwent oophorectomy after their diagnosis .

skygazers in the west u . s . , canada , australia and new zealand were treated to a total eclipse of the moon before dawn on saturday .  ' blood moon ' refers to its orange or red appearance , which is the result of sunlight scattering off earth ' s atmosphere .  the eclipse is the third in a series of four blood moons , with the final one expected on september 28 .

the last of the woolly mammoths were isolated on an arctic island for around 5 , 000 years , forcing them to inbreed as their population dwindled until disappering 4 , 500 years ago .  researchers studied the structure of dna from mammoths preserved in the arctic to reproduce exact copies of 14 of the extinct animal ’ s genes .  these were then integrated by experts at harvard university in massachusetts into the elephant genome - and functioned as normal dna .

researchers at the university of huddersfield have created a technique which they claim can distinguish between the genetic fingerprints of identical twins .  identical twins start life with the same genes because they come from the same fertilised egg which divides into two embryos .  as they age different life experiences , such as smoking or diet , create variations in the number of hydrogen bonds in the dna .

the large hadron collider was restarted today after two years being upgraded .  scientists hope to see dark matter for the first time ever thanks to the device ' s upgrade .  the lhc is currently running at a low ' injection ' energy of 450 giga - electron volts ( gev ) in june it will increase to a record - breaking 13 tera - - up from 7 tev at the time it managed to detect the higgs boson in 2013 .

indonesia tops the list of countries with the most threatened mammals .  despite only occupying 1 per cent of the earth ' s land mass , indonesia ' s rainforests are home to 12 % of mammal species in the world .  madagascar is second , with 114 endangered mammals , while mexico sits in third with 101 . 5 .  experts from lancaster university recently surveyed households in the cities of borba and novo aripuana to find out which animals they hunt and eat from the rainforest .

hiv specialists and network security experts at university college london made the disovery after creating a simulation of how the virus spreads .  they say the spread of hiv through the body was similar to how some computer worms spread through both the internet and local networks respectively .  as hiv progresses , it reduces the number of active t - cells in the body until the immune system cannot function correctly , a state known as ' acquired immune deficiency syndrome ' or aids .

the yellowstone supervolcano is one of the largest active continental silicic volcanic fields in the world .  it is situated in yellowstone national park - which spans the midwestern us states of wyoming , idaho and montana - and last erupted 640 , 000 years ago .  experts say there is a one in 700 , 000 annual chance of a volcanic eruption at the site .

photographer jeffrey milstein has shot a fascinating project documenting black boxes , and parts of boxes , that have been recovered from aircraft accidents .  the boxes , which record flight data and conversations between pilots , are incredibly important for discovering what led to a plane ' s crash .  after disaster strikes , there is an immediate attempt to cover the black box - as seen in recent tragedies such as germanwings flight 4u 9525 .

fossils of a creature bearing a ' striking ' similarity to depictions of nessie have been found in a 19th century collection .  they were discovered when the president of the official loch ness fan club , gary miller , was invited to the museum and spotted them .  the name ' pterichthyodes ' refers to the creatures ' odd wing - like appendages coming from the ancient greek for ' wing - fish ' .

dave tyler , 72 , built and built his own observatory in 1977 and now uses powerful telescopes to observe and photograph the solar system .  the 72 - year - old first became interested in astronomy after seeing the first episode of the bbc ' s sky at night in 1957 .  he said : ' the sun is awesome and many people do not even realise it is a star .  through my scopes it is an amazing sight ' .

in 84 days from november 2013 to january 2014 , the area around azle , texas , shook with 27 magnitude two or greater earthquakes .  now scientists believe these earthquakes were the result of high - pressure injection of drilling wastewater into the ground .  oil and gas industry uses injection wells to get rid of wastewater , which can have chemicals , heavy metals , salt and radioactive material .
the ohio - based national school safety and security services reviewed more than 800 school threats covered in the media during the first half of the 2014 - 15 academic year .  about one - third of cases involved violent remarks sent anonymously via text message , social media , email or other online means .  law enforcement officers say the use of the modern technologies has made it much harder to determine if a threat is real and to find the culprit .
latvia - based drive eo has created a one megawatt electric race car .  it runs on 50 kwh lithium - ion battery pack that drives six yasa - 400 electric motors .  it is capable of producing 1020 kw ( 1368 horsepower ) , compared to the top speed of 155 mph ( 249 km ) the race is the second oldest motor racing event in the us and runs on a challenging 12 . 42 mile ( 20km ) course with 156 turns in colorado springs .

research on infants ' brains by doctors from oxford university found that young babies are more sensitive to pain than adults .  it overturns the medical consensus that newborns have a high pain thresholds are even lower than those of adults .  new findings suggest it is possible to see pain ‘ happening ’ inside the infant brain - and it looks a lot like pain in adults .

shigella infections , otherwise known as ' delhi belly ' or ' montezuma ' s revenge ' were traced to people who had recently traveled to the dominican republic , india or other countries .  the symptoms include diarrhea , stomach cramps and nausea .  the centers for disease control and prevention released the report thursday .  the superbug sickened at least 243 people , in 32 states and puerto rico . sometimes antibiotics are prescribed , especially for more serious cases .

vets are urging the public to get their dogs checked out for ticks .  lyme disease is a potentially fatal illness caught from tick bites .  ticks are tiny tick - like creatures found in woodland and heath areas .  they feed on the blood of birds and mammals , including humans .  symptoms may be so mild that someone who ' s been bitten by an infected tick may experience only flu - like symptoms .

developers in boston have worked with global emergency response teams to create its one - touch - 911 app .  users can call the police , fire service , report a car crash or seek medical help at the press of a single button .  each call is placed with the phone ' s gps location , user details and any pre - entered medical information attached .  if the user doesn ' t have signal on their network , the app lets them ' roam ' onto another network to connect the call .

as short waves collide near the surface they create weak microseismic waves , which combine with long waves on the ocean ' s floor to create a constant hum .  earthquakes shake the planet in such a way that the earth can oscillate for months after the seismic event .  researchers in the mid - 1990s found the hum can drop as low as an e flat , 20 octaves below middle c on the musical scale .

experts believe the molalla log cabin was constructed as early as 1795 - ten years before lewis and clark reached the pacific ocean .  historic building repairer gregg olson and architectural historian pam hayden have been analyzing the log cabin for seven years and say it is unlike anything else found in oregon .  olson and hayden hypothesize that the cabin could have been a home for a group of 10 to 50 russian settlers sent to the willamette valley as farmers to feed fur traders in alaska .

the image , together with data collected by the european space agency , suggests these structures only have three million years left before they fade away .  new evidence reveal many new details — including a previously unseen jet from a young star .  they shed about 70 times the mass of the sun every million years or so .  for more stars to form in environments like the pillars of creation , it is a race against time as intense radiation from the powerful stars that are already shining continues to grind away at the pillars .

some dark , vibrant ink seems to cause the watch ’ s heart rate monitor to lose connection and give inaccurate readings .  tests suggest that tattoos in dark and solid colours interfere with the device the most . this is because the heart sensor reads a pulse by measuring light absorption though the skin - a process called photoplethysmography - leads the watch to think it has stopped making contact with the skin .

led screens found in most electronic devices can harm the retina .  this is the light - sensitive layer at the back of the eye - and may even lead to partial blindness .  dr celia sanchez - ramos says modern led screens emit up to five times as much blue light as older technology .  in extreme cases , it may lead to macular degeneration , which causes dark patches to appear in the centre of the field of vision .

in 1992 , a drug enforcement agency monitored every telephone call made from the u . s . to one of the up to 116 countries on their watch list for drug trafficking , including almost every country in both north and south america .  this is now the oldest known example of the american government authorizing this level of tracking on unknowing citizens of the country .  the goal was to infiltrate drug trafficking rings , especially those that were previously unknown to the dea and federal government .

the stormy weather system , formed in the tasman sea , hasn ' t hit nsw this strong since 2007 .  east coast lows are particularly common in june and tend to be more frequent in autumn and winter .  they are characterised by gales or storm force winds that can damage buildings , fell trees and powerlines .  an estimated 100 , 000 homes are without power on tuesday morning across sydney , the central coast and hunter region .

research was carried out by scientists at brown university in rhode island .  to conduct the study , researchers pitted nine frequent gamers against a control group of nine people who game rarely , if ever .  they participated in a two - day trial of visual task learning .  subjects were shown an on - screen ‘ texture ’ of either visual or horizontal lines and had to quickly point out - in a fraction of a second - the one area where anomalous texture appeared .

quota system was abolished today after 30 years - allowing dairy farmers to produce as much milk as they like without suffering a financial penalty .  move is expected to drive a spike in production , particularly in countries like germany , germany and the netherlands .  british farmers are likely to find the price they are paid by supermarkets is driven down , which will be difficult for smaller family businesses .

a washington , dc - based company wants to create a new space station .  their giant cylinder could apparently replace the iss .  it would rotate four times per minute to create artificial gravity .  and would be 1 , 300ft ( 400 metres ) long , cost £200 billion ( $ 300 billion ) and take 30 years to build .

bones found in gough ' s cave in somerset had flesh cut from them .  tooth marks on many of the bones were discovered in the cave during excavations between 1880 and 1992 .  archaeologists say findings suggest people living in the late ice age indulged in ritual cannibalism , perhaps as a macabre way to revere their dead kin .

youtube user micahmedia has uploaded a video of the simplest and swiftest way to peel a hardboiled egg using a glass of water .  he pops the egg into a small tumbler glass before filling it a quarter of the way with water .  after ten seconds of shaking , he lifts his hand to show the egg , which has been loosened from left to right so that the water doesn ' t spill .  the 28 - second video currently has over 16million views on youtube .

the sleep health foundation has released a study reporting that 30 percent of australians complain about their lack of sleep on a daily basis .  the average adult needs around eight hours of sleep per night with a range of seven to nine .  any less than six hours or any more than 10 hours is unusual for the standard person .

at its peak in 1950 , the ndrf consisted of nearly 2 , 280 ships moored across the united states .  at its height in the 1950s , the fleet consisted of 2 , 277 ships , reduced to 230 by 2007 , and 122 in 2007 .  today , just over 120 ships remain , posing a risk to the environment in the bays where they are moored .  the worst affected mooring side is suisun bay in california where less than 50 ships remain .

researchers from germany , canada and the united states analysed answers to the hitler question from 6 , 100 people .  they found that significantly more men than women would kill to save lives further down the line , while women were more troubled by the act itself and would often decide to do nothing .  another question imagined that the only way out of poverty and stavation was making a young girl do sex work for money .

church of england ' s ambitious plans involve harnessing the energy of bath ’ s 45°c spring water to power a modern heating system for the building .  engineers plan to excavate ancient crypts below the church to tap into a roman drain where 850 , 000 litres of natural spring water empties every day into the ground .  they hope to divert the warm water instead through a network of underground pipes to provide a world - first natural underfloor heating system .
april 2 is autism awareness day and autism assistance dogs are a little known but hugely beneficial form of ' animal therapy ' .  the term ' autism spectrum disorders ' ( asd ) is an umbrella term that includes autistic disorder ; asperger ' s and atypical autism .  it can provide companionship for the child , as well as social and emotional support for the parent to bring joy and ' brightness ' to the household .

researchers at the technical university of braunschweig , germany , found that passive smoking affects plants too , which can take up nicotine from contaminated soil and plumes of smoke .  the finding may explain why some spices , herbal teas and medicinal plants have high concentrations of nicotine in them , despite none being allowed in insecticides .

two - inch - long asian hornets pose terrible danger to our honeybees .  they pick off bees as they leave their hive until the colony is so exhausted .  uk beekeepers have been sent email alerts by defra asking them to be on the look - out for the menaces .  one asian hornet can kill 40 bees in a minute , while a handful can destroy a hive of 30 , 000 bees .

the national radio astronomy observatory is objecting to proposals to release a radio wave - guided lawnmower .  it claims irobot ' s machines will interfere with its sensitive radio telescopes which astronomers are using to pick up signs of alien life .  the problem is the frequency band proposed for the lawnbot is 6240 - 6740 mhz - the same one several large radio telescopes operate on .  there is already a ban on the use of mobile phone close to the green bank telescope in west virginia .

' .  he then cracks the smaller egg , which also has a yolk and white inside .  the unusual occurrence is called a counter - peristalsis contraction .

neuroscientists used a robot to interfere with the sensory signals in the brains of blindfolded volunteers .  test subjects performed movements with their hand attached to a robotic device .  when conducted in real time , the participant ' s brain could adapt and recognize it as their own movement because of the synchronized movement .  findings appear to explain the common experience people have of feeling an unseen presence , even a guardian angel or apparition stalking their movements .

desert fairy circles are large barren patches of earth measuring anywhere between 10ft and 65ft in diameter ( three metres to 20 metres ) that are ringed by short grass dotting the scrub land like craters on the moon , or big freckles .  researchers have found a similar pattern in two apparently unrelated places - skin cells in human skin and the mysterious fairy circles in the namibian desert .  they are also arranged in polygons .

small businesses and restaurants will be forced to close over the easter long weekend as they struggle to cover the costs of penalty rates on public holidays .  the penalty rates will come into force from good friday to easter monday in retail , restaurant , hotel , fast food , dry cleaning , amusements and hair and beauty sectors .  acci chief executive kate carnell said businesses that remain open are expected to lose money , with the extra holiday trade cancelled out by the extra wage costs .

naomi jacobs was 32 when she woke up one morning when she thought she was 15 years old .  she had been struck with transient global amnesia , a form of memory loss brought on by stress .  the condition caused the ' episodic ' part of her memory to shut down , meaning she could remember things she had repeated over time such as how to drive and phone numbers .

geneticists at harvard university have revealed that ancient european populations were dark skinned for far longer than originally been thought .  rather than lightening as early humans migrated north from africa around 40 , 000 years ago due to lower levels of sunlight , these first homo sapiens retained their dark skin colour .  around 5 , 800 years ago , the second gene , which makes skin colour lighter still , also began to spread though the european population .

the modular robotic vehicle , or mrv , was developed at nasa ' s johnson space center to show off the technologies that could let man move across other planets .  unlike a normal car , the buggy has no mechanical linkages to the propulsion , steering , or brake actuators .  a turn of the steering wheel , for instance , is recorded by sensors and sent to computers at the rear of the vehicle .

the attraction , at fancesa limestone quarry in sucre , bolivia , comprises some 462 trails made up of 5 , 055 prints .  frequent landslides reveal new ones , some of which belong to unknown species .  the wall , which is approximately 390 feet ( 120 metres ) tall , features tracks made by at least eight species of dinosaurs .  it ' s thought the late jurassic dinosaurs were more than 75 ft ( 23 metres ) long and weighed up to 40 tonnes .

chinese scientists have reported a 23 % reduction in myopia – short - sightedness – in children who spend an extra 40 minutes a day in the sunshine .  scientists had though reading or looking at a screen could cause shortsightedness , but now think it could be down to a lack of natural light while taking part in these activities .  leading eye surgeon david allamby said an increase in eyesight problems is likely in britain if children do not regain a love of the great outdoors .

the arrows were placed at the base of lit beacons near airways , showing pilots the direction they needed to fly in to reach the next stop - off to deliver mail .  by 1929 , the arrows could be seen for a distance of up to 10 miles so pilots could find their way .  the arrows define a moment in history at the beginning of the 21st century when the us postal service began delivering air mail .

scientists in the us and italy say they have evidence that dna - like fragments may have come with ' instructions ' that guided their growth into complex life forms 4 billion years ago .  rna , which stands for ribonucleic acid , is a molecule made up of one or more nucleotides .  it is one of three major biological molecules that are essential for all known forms of life , along with dna and proteins .

heart patients who expressed gratitude for the positive things in their life had improved mental , and ultimately physical , health .  study involved men and women who had been diagnosed with stage b heart failure .  patients who were more grateful had lower markers of inflammation , which can worsen heart failure - where risk of death is five times higher .

two - thirds of people taking antidepressants did not meet criteria for major depressive disorder , which is also known as clinical depression .  but 38 per cent of those taking the drugs didn ' t meet the criteria for obsessive compulsive disorder , panic disorder , social phobia or generalised anxiety disorder either .  u . s . guidelines say clinical depression should be diagnosed if a person has five or more depressive symptoms over a two week period , most of the day .

neuroscientists have identified the area of the brain that is the key to picking up on when someone is being sarcastic .  stroke survivors often suffer damage to the right sagittal stratum - a bundle of white matter that lies between the cerebral cortex and subcortical structures in the brain .  study will surprise anybody whose boss relies on mocking his employees to get the best out of them .

neanderthals were the dominant human species in europe and much of asia for around 250 , 000 years before vanishing .  scientists took ct scans of a tooth found in riparo bombrini in western ligurian alps and in the grotta di fumane in western lessini mountains in italy .  they found they belonged to ancestors of modern humans who were part of a group known as the protoaurignacian culture .

the southern poverty law center in february filed a lawsuit against georgia department of corrections officials on behalf of ashley diamond , a transgender woman .  the lawsuit says prison officials have failed to provide adequate treatment for diamond ' s gender dysphoria , a condition that causes a person to experience extreme distress because of a disconnect between the birth sex and gender identity .

actress , 39 , wants to install a boulder and gravel seawall along west sussex coast to protect her £3 . 25million beachside home .  natural england has recommended the planning application be refused - citing concerns it may result in the ' direct loss ' of natural habitat designated for rare and vulnerable birds , trees and wetlands .  it is unclear what effect the sea wall would have on a public footpath that runs along the bottom of the estate by the seashore .
the ancient tuscan settlement , based 40 miles south east of genoa , is shrouded in mystery with its origin .  a number of historical earthquakes , including one in 1887 that measured 6 . 7 on the richter scale , caused severe damage to the town ’ s infrastructure .  today the town is considered to be the most famous abandoned location in italy and folklore suggests that the area is haunted .
six infrared cameras allow pilots to ' look through ' the air - frame .  when the pilot looks down , they see the world below them in their visor .  all of the information they need to complete their mission - airspeed , altitude and even warnings systems - are projected straight onto the helmet ' s visor rather than the traditional ' heads - up display ' .  each piece of high - tech headgear costs nearly half a million dollars , which is reportedly millions over its original budget .

children who ate a diet higher in saturated fats and cholesterol had slower reaction times and a poorer working memory .  scientists at the university of illinois recruited 150 children aged between seven and 10 and gave them a game which involved learning a pattern between a set of shapes and colours .  the game was designed to test cognitive flexibility , which is our ability to shift attention , select information and alter our response strategy to fit the changing demands of a task .

scientists at the university of connecticut say we know how far away the source of a sound is by listening to the echoes it produces .  in a study they found that the reverberation of sound helps us locate the distance of , for example , a car passing round a bend or a person nearby .  researchers said that echoes and fluctuations in volume are the cues we use to figure out the distance .

the immerse virtual reality headset is available from firebox for £29 . 95 ( $ 45 ) it works with any android and ios phone that can run virtual reality apps from the respective stores , and will play any 3d movie .  the maximum size of compatible devices is 3 . 5 x 5 . 7 - inches ( 8 . 2 x 15 . 4cm ) , which means it will work with the iphone 6 plus , for example .

jeff bezos ' blue origin company has completed a successful spaceflight test in west texas .  the new shepard vehicle rose to a height of 58 miles ( 94km ) - four miles short of space - before landing .  it was unmanned , but will ultimately take six people into space .  the test took place from the company ’ s launch site in west .
scientists have found vast deep water gas hydrates in the arctic .  they are reservoirs for abiotic methane which is 20 times more effective in trapping heat than carbon dioxide .  gasinisation occurs when seawater reacts with hot mantle rocks exhumed along large faults within the seafloor .  scientists say similar formations could someday be used to store methane , that can later be used as fuel .
a university of cambridge scientist has revealed his green source of energy .  by using just moss he is able to generate enough power to run a clock .  he said panels of plant material could power appliances in our homes .  and the technology could help farmers grow crops where electricity is scarce .

experts have voiced concerns over diy brain stimulation kits for children that are being sold online .  for a few hundred dollars , one can be purchased online from various sites and delivered to your door .  professor colleen loo from the black dog institute has been researching transcranial direct current stimulation ( tdcs ) for 20 years .

medical professionals at the university of arkansas for medical sciences in little rock ruled out several causes for a 56 - year - old man ' s kidney failure .  black tea has high levels of oxalate , a chemical known to produce kidney stones and even lead to kidney failure if consumed in excessive doses .

the eshima ohashi bridge in japan rises sharply so ships can pass underneath .  the two - lane concrete road bridge stretches 1 . 7km or just over 1 mile long .  it has a gradient of 6 . 1 per cent on the shimane prefecture side and remains in the world ' s top twenty highest .

gold coast city council will finally be able to shut down illegal party houses in suburban areas after the state government approved new planning powers .  there are more than 700 party houses across the city , which are often used for unruly weekend - long parties that distress and terrify neighbours due to noise , nudity , lewd behaviour and violence .  the new powers , approved by deputy premier and planning minister jackie trad , means there is now an official and legal definition of a party house .

seven of the world ' s most endangered crocodiles flew from melbourne to the philippines today .  the custom - designed boxes which the crocodiles travelled in contained canvas bags cushioned by soft wood wool .  the reptiles were conceived and hatched at the melbourne zoo , the first and only australian zoo to breed them .  there are only about 250 philippines crocodiles left in the wild , making them the most endangered crocodilian species in the world .

more than 600 people are part of the havasupai tribe , which is the smallest indian nation in america .  visitors can reach the tribe on foot or by helicopter or mule , and experience life in the village of supai .  the picturesque plot was claimed by the national park rangers in 1975 .  the tribe also grow food and weave as a source of livelihood , although being situated at the base of the canyon has left them vulnerable to flooding .

radar images from europe ' s sentinel - 1a satellite have revealed the aftermath of the nepal earthquake in unrivalled detail .  by comparing before and after images , scientists have discovered mount everest shrank by about one inch due to the land that was shaken in the natural disaster .  an area 75 miles ( 120km ) by 30 miles ( 50km ) has lifted up 3 . 2ft ( 1 metre ) from the ground around the capital , kathmandu .

the technology is based on a technique known as ' neuromodulation ' .  electricity from a chip stimulates the nervous system to restore sight .  when the patient puts on the system ' s dark glasses , an integrated video camera sends images to a portable computer .  pulses activate electrodes in the implant , and the optic nerve carries images to the brain .

families in the uk are more indebted than those in many other developed nations , said the international monetary fund .  the uk was singled out as having a problem with household debt , along with portugal – lumping britain together with a country that was forced to seek emergency funding during the eurozone crisis .  rising house prices have pushed up household debt in britain in recent years – raising fears that families are over - stretching themselves to get on the property ladder or buy a bigger home .

documented and undocumented immigrant population in the united states could reach a record high of 51million in just eight years .  one in seven u . s . residents will be an immigrant by 2023 , the center for immigration studies said .  without no change in current immigration policy , immigrants who arrive in the future and their descendants could account for three quarters of future population .

statistics collected at maastricht university in holland , where cannabis is decriminalised .  students who were able to buy the drug from coffee shops were five percent less likely to pass their courses .  at the same time , foreign students who did not have ready access to the mind bending drug did better on average .  study will rankle with the increasing number calling for the legislation of cannabis around the world .

researchers will monitor how plants grow in a particular direction .  the results could help farmers on earth get a higher crop yield .  results could also help future astronauts grow plants on missions beyond earth orbit to the moon and mars .  the plant gravity sensing study will be conducted when new supplies are taken to the iss by a spacex dragon capsule on 13 april .  if the study proves successful , it could help humans grow their own food in space , helping in the quest to colonise other planets .

there is a rising number of firms in the us that sell biscuits containing cannabidiol , or cbd , taken from hemp . compounds in the plant have been known to alleviate joint pains , treat mood disorders and even help animals lose weight .  hemp is legally refined in industrial factories for products such as hemp seed foods , hemp oil , wax , rope , paper , and fuel .

palaeontologists are referring to chilesaurus diegosuarezi as a ' platypus ' dinosaur because of its bizarre combination of characteristics .  the animal is proving to be an evolutionary jigsaw puzzle because it belongs to the theropod group of dinosaurs .  the presence of herbivorous theropods was up until now only known in close relatives of birds , but chilesaurus shows that a meat - free diet was acquired much earlier than first thought .

nine sections of the wall have been found over the last two months along the inner coast of the yellow river in gansu province and the ningxia region .  experts say the new stretch means the full range of the qin dynasty great wall can be traced for the first time .  parts of the great wall date back to about 700 bc , the first complete wall was built during the reign of china ' s first emperor , qin shihuang .

a pair of turkey - sized ‘ egg thief lizards ’ dubbed romeo and juliet were found lying next to each other in a 75 - million - year - old rock in the mid - 90s .  palaeontologists led by scott persons believe they can tell males and females apart from certain tail bones .  they say that the key differences between the sexes lie in bones near the base of the tail .

there were 72 unprovoked shark attacks around the world last year , with three people killed in australia and south africa .  despite the worrying statistics , only a minority of sharks are any danger to humans , with great white , bull and tiger sharks accounting for the vast majority of attacks .  reunion has recorded seven fatal shark attacks in the past five years , more per capita than anywhere else in the world .

calfornia gov .  jerry brown ordered a 25 percent overall cutback in water use by cities and towns in the golden state on wednesday .  the crackdown comes as california and its nearly 40 million residents move toward a fourth summer of drought with no relief in sight .  state reservoirs have a year ' s worth of water , and with record low snowfall over the winter there won ' t be much to replenish them .  wells in some parts of the state are going dry as water levels fall .

images show a shoal of fish making way for a blacktip shark swimming in the shallow waters of heron island in queensland , australia .  it ’ s thought that the reef shark was not interested in catching a meal , but the fish naturally keep their distance , creating circles of clear water around the predator .  fish are thought to gain many benefits from shoaling behaviour , such as keeping safe from predators as well as boosting their chances of feeding and finding a mate .

little zane gbangbola died at home in the middle of the night after being poisoned .  police and other official agencies ruled out fears that deadly fumes had come from a nearby landfill site .  instead , they insisted carbon monoxide from a faulty pump hired by his family had caused his death .  but damning new evidence proves authorities have known for 14 months that hydrogen cyanide gas capable of killing zane had leaked into family ' s home as it was engulfed by floodwater .

researchers have developed a model that combined long - term fisheries data with climate model projections from the met office .  from this they predicted the abundance and distribution of popular fish , such as haddock and plaice , could fall as the north sea warms .  this could increase the price of fish and chips , or see them being taken off the menu completely .

psychologists at new york university have been trying to gain an understanding about how the brain stores memories for ' emotionally neutral events ' that gain significance through subsequent experience .  emotion increases our ability to remember by affecting activity in brain regions involved in emotional processing - particularly the amygdala and striatum .  a power nap of just 45 minutes can boost memory by five times , research has found .

us researchers say very few weight loss plans have solid evidence to back up their claims . results suggest only a few programmes have shown their users lose more weight than those not using them .  but a handful - including weight watchers , the atkins diet , jenny craig and nutrisystem - do appear to be effective , according to long - term studies .

the 99 . 7 per cent accurate biosure hiv self test enables people to test themselves when and where they like .  the testing kit , on sale online , uses a small amount of blood from a finger - prick sample to detect the presence of hiv antibodies .  treatments available mean hiv is now a manageable disease – but late diagnosis can have a devastating impact on health and life expectancy .

scientists from the university of wollongong are designing ultra - durable condoms they claim could feel even better than nothing at all .  the contraceptive is made with hydrogel , a strong and flexible solid which can be made to feel and act like human tissue .  the groundbreaking design will eventually offer functions like self - lubrication , topical drug delivery and even electric conductivity .

bon apetit has revealed the best way to revive a stale loaf of bread .  it doesn ' t matter if the water is hot or cold but you should try to keep the cut edge away from the direct flow of water .  when you have wet your bread put it in the oven for between 6 and 13 minutes depending on how large and how wet the loaf is .

researchers from london and edinburgh have developed a computer that can collate meterological information and then produce forecasts as if they were written by a human .  it uses a process known as ' natural language generation ' ( nlg ) these computer - generated weather updates are being tested by scientists at heriot - watt university and university college london .  if the project is successful , a prototype system will be tested by generating local weather reports on the mailonline ' s website .

tewksbury police department came under attack by criminals who infected their network with a form of internet malware in december .  the program called cryptolocker infects through an e - mail and then scrambles the data on the computer .  it caused police systems to be down between four and five days .  the only files that were 18 months old , so cops were left paying the ransom in the untraceable digital currency or they risked losing the data forever .

researchers from national chung hsing university in taiwan studied the expression of a class of genes known to be associated with petal development .  they found its shape is determined by two competing groups of proteins .  by tweaking them , they can convert this lip into petals in two orchid species by reducing the activity of the l complex using gene silencing .  lips attract insect pollinators and serve as a landing platform for them .

the image was created by superimposing a blurry picture of marilyn monroe over a picture of albert einstein drawn in fine lines .  features with a high spatial frequency ( einstein ) are only visible when viewing them close up , and those with low spatial frequencies are only from further away . combining pictures of the two produces a single image which changes when the viewer moves closer or farther away from the screen .

kenton lee , from nampa , idaho , came up with the idea while working in nairobi in kenya after seeing children running around barefoot and in shoes several sizes too small .  the shoe has adjustable points at the front , sides and the back of the sandal to help it expand .  pressure sensors in the shoe tell it when your foot is in position , triggering a tiny motor in the heel that pulls the laces tight .
patients at wolfson children ' s hospital are able to remotely play with animals .  the system uses high - definition cameras and interactive toys .  children can control three different cat toys at the shelter with the push of a button , and then watch on the tv as the animals react and play with them .  the idaho firm has already installed its system in 10 animals shelters across the us , letting anyone play with cats via the system .

fergus simpson from university of barcelona applied a mathematical formula to assume aliens obey the same laws of conservation of energy as animals on earth .  this means that larger animals need more resources to survive , so are less common than plentiful ants , for example .  mr simpson said there must be a minimum size necessary for supporting intelligent life , based on the range of body sizes of intelligent animals such as apes and humans .

the trackyourdose app was developed by germany - based firm esooka .  it uses a mathematical model developed by scientists and meteorologists .  since 1997 , ptb has studied the cosmic radiation at typical flight altitudes and used this to calculate radiation levels .  it can measure all the relevant types of radiation , in particular neutron radiation produced in the atmosphere .

sam schmidt drove a sports car on the long beach grand prix road course sunday despite being paralyzed from the neck down .  the modified 2014 corvette c7 stingray allowed schmidt to navigate the car independently using only his head and mouth .  schmidt completed the difficult task with the help of a semi - autonomous motorcar , or sam car .  the car includes integrated advanced electronics and a human - to - machine interface which allows quadriplegics to safely operate the vehicle under ' racetrack conditions ' .

deep brain stimulation ( dbs ) is a technique already used to treat parkinson ' s disease .  it can boost memory by causing new brain cells to be formed .  experiments on rats found the therapy improved their powers of recall , and it is hoped the same will apply to humans .  the device was implanted into middle aged rats , sending out minute electrical impulses , and the animals performed better in memory tests compared to those who had not been stimulated , even after 24 hours .
researchers observed factors such as the adult ’ s level of engagement with the child and how distracted they seemed .  children whose carers were distracted were ‘ significantly ’ more likely to behave in this way .  electronic devices such as mobile phones were responsible for 30 per cent of all parental distractions .

synaesthesia is a neurological condition in which two or more senses experienced separately are involuntarily joined together .  researchers from the department of psychology at stanford university used data from 6 , 588 registered users to determine which colours are most commonly associated with which letters .  they compared these colour - letter matches to fridge magnets sold by fisher - price between 1971 and 1990 .

meg and jess doggett were trained for six months to sniff out dry rot .  they stop , stare at it and point with their nose , only moving from affected area when mr doggett gives them a special signal .  the dogs are so effective because they can detect dry rot at much earlier stages .

researchers studied stone tools that were used by people in the early ahmarian culture and the protoaurignacian culture , living in south and west asia and west europe around 40 , 000 years ago .  they found the human tools were no more effective than neanderthal - created tools of the same era .  researchers say the discovery means we may need to rethink the reasons humans survived - and that we may not have behaved as differently as we thought .

sean crawford , from carterton , new zealand , uses dead animals into unique works of art .  he has been influenced by gothic revival architecture and literature that dealt with themes of being dismantled and put back together .  mr crawford has three animal sculptures on display at traffic jam galleries at neutral bay on sydney ' s lower north shore .  he said he can understand why some people find his work ' a bit ungodly ' .
research looked at the voting habits of twins born in the uk .  aim was to explore how much nature and nurture influence our party political allegiances and potential voting preferences .  identical twins share 100 per cent of their genes , while non - identical twins normally share the same environment while growing up .
researchers from grand valley state university in lyon and the university of california analysed the behaviour of both sexes when the study participants were asked to choose between being paid on their individual performance or as part of a team .  less than 11 % of men opted for team payment , in comparison to 44 per cent of women .  study could have implications for other areas outside sport , such as in the workplace where greater gender diversity could bring advantages .

panel will focus on thousands of ' adjustments ' that have been made to temperature records kept at individual weather stations around the world .  sceptics have argued that the effect of such adjustments – made when instruments are replaced or recalibrated , or heat - producing buildings are erected close to weather station sites .  panel will also examine ‘ extrapolations ’ – when the records include virtual figures from places where there is no actual measuring station , instead basing them on the figures of other stations .

egypt ' s old kingdom collapsed more than 4 , 200 years ago because it failed to adapt to climate change , claims professor eric cline .  he claims a series of droughts , famines , climate change and internal rebellions between 1225bc and 1177 bc happened in quick succession .  scientists examined 7 , 000 - year - old ancient pollen and charcoal samples from the nile to piece together the time - and found evidence of a ' mega drought ' in the area .

number of christians in the us will decline from three quarters of the population in 2010 to just two thirds in 2050 , researchers claim .  percentage of atheists across the globe is expected to fall across the same time frame while muslims will outnumber christians by 2070 .  islam will be the fastest growing religion in the world over the next four decades .

gel contains platelet - rich plasma ( prp ) - a concentrated mix of substances in the blood that play a role in healing .  u . s . researchers are testing the new gel as a dressing for burns .  spinning the blood leaves behind the plasma and the platelets but in higher concentration - up to ten times greater than usual .

scientists from the university of connecticut warned that one in six animals are at risk of extinction if we do nothing to combat climate change .  while another group of researchers have added to the forecast with a separate study , which warns that marine animals near north america , antarctica and new zealand are most likely to die out .  if future temperatures increase by only two degrees compared to pre - industrial levels , the extinction risk would increase from 2 . 8 to 5 . 2 per cent .

shinto kanamara matsuri started as a small tradition but has grown into a popular tourist attraction .  participants pray to a god who is said to help with fertility , child birth and protection from sexually transmitted infections .  festivalgoers parade through the streets with three giant phalluses , while spectators lick lollies or snack on sausages or vegetables shaped as male and female genitalia .

nasa has put together a team of ' extraterrestrial experts ' to see if any of the planets discovered outside our solar system are habitable .  the initiative will include scientists from 10 universities including stanford , the university of california and yale .  it will include those who study earth as a life - bearing planet , discovering worlds orbiting other stars in the galaxy .  the announcement comes just weeks after nasa ' s top scientist predicted we could be on the verge of finding life on one of them .
scientists in colorado have found evidence for a new solar season cycle .  every two years it appears ' bands ' of magnetic field move to the surface .  this combines with the existing 11 - year solar cycle , causing even more powerful coronal mass ejections ( cmes ) and solar flares that can damage satellites and have an enormous financial cost .

the megalithic site of gunung padang was discovered in 1914 and is the largest site of its kind in indonesia .  it is nestled among volcanoes , banana palms and tea plantations , at 2 , 903 ft ( 885 metres ) above sea level some 75 miles ( 120km ) south of jakarta .  if true , the claim could rewrite prehistory and shed light on an obscure yet powerful ancient civilisation .

swedish scientists analysed more than 10 , 000 families with children aged two to 14 who did not have the condition .  they found many were among those badly affected by events in their formative years .  subsequently , 58 children were diagnosed with type 1 diabetes .  other factors include viral infection , dietary habits , birth weight and early weight gain .

scientists from the university of california santa barbara , california , discovered the virus while exploring methane vents 2 , 800 feet beneath the seabed off the coast of japan .  this is because the virus actively causes one of its own genes to mutate - allowing it to develop new ways of coping with the ecosystem .  the findings have raised the prospect that life may still be clinging on on deep underground on planets such as mars .

higher doses of vitamin e , found in foods such as kale and almonds , can mitigate the stress on immune cells .  one sub - class of these cells , the cd8 + t cells , eliminate the virus by killing cells it has infected .  a week can pass before these cells cells start to take their toll on a virus .  this immune response does not work if significant oxidative stress is damaging the t cells and depriving the body of the tools it needs to repair .

children who share ipads in class do much better in early literacy tests than those who don ’ t , researchers claim .  courtney blackwell , at northwestern university in the us , found kindergarten children who shared ipads significantly outscored their peers who were in classes that had no ipads or in which each student had their own device .  shared ipad students scored around 30 points higher than students who used the device on their own and non - ipad users .

the instinct to avoid arachnids developed as an evolutionary response to a dangerous threat .  it could date back to early human evolution in africa , where spiders with strong venom existed millions of years ago .  the instinct could mean that arachnophobia , one of the most crippling of phobias , represents a finely tuned survival instinct .

apple has bought israel - based link computational imaging in a deal reportedly worth $ 20 million ( £13 . 5 million ) linx makes ' multi - aperture ' cameras small enough to fit into smartphones and tablets that come with depth - sensing technology .  rather than capturing a flat 2d image , the technology is able to sense the depth of each object in a photograph .  this lets people refocus an image after its been captured or measure the dimensions of a room , for example .

the red lady ' s remains were found in the el miron cave in cantabria , spain .  radiocarbon dating suggests she was buried 18 , 700 years ago .  when the remains were first uncovered they were stained with a sparking red material , later found to be red ochre from a haematite crystal .  researchers from the university of new mexico unearthed a mandible and tibia that suggested a full skeleton was placed towards the rear of the cave .

a ' bone flute ' found in slovenia is not an instrument - but it is chewed by a hyena with teeth marks .  the bone was discovered on 18 july 1995 in slovenia .  anthropologists at the university kansas say the talons appear to have been made into symbolic jewellery 80 , 000 years before modern humans arrived in europe .  the findings add to evidence that neanderthals were not the slow - witted and primitive creatures they are often portrayed as .

the mineral veins were found at a site called ' garden city ' on the slopes of mount sharp and stick up from the rock by up to 6cm ( 2 . 5 inches ) scientists believe the bizarre network of ridges formed in mars ' wet past billions of years ago above the now eroded bedrock .  veins such as these form where fluids move through cracked rock and leave minerals in the fractures , often affecting the chemistry of the rock surrounding the fractures .

gibbons have been found to use soft ' hoo ' calls that are almost inaudible to the human ear .  the apes , found in the forest of south east asia , produce a variety of soft call types , known as ' hoos ' .  this suggests the quiet calls were produced at frequencies well below the threshold of hearing for eagles and other birds of prey .

david crossley , 63 , from birmingham , developed large kidney stones .  they were so large ( 6 mm across ) they could not be passed naturally .  they start causing pain - known as renal colic - once they travel down the ureter , the narrow tube that carries urine from the kidney to the bladder .  once on the move , a stone can take days or weeks to travel out of the body .

fossils from an extinct pygmy sperm whale that died seven million years ago have shed new light on the evolution of modern day whales .  the remains , which were discovered in panama , indicate that the organ involved in sound generation and echolocation got smaller throughout the whale ’ s evolution .  in contrast modern sperm whales are much larger than their extinct relatives .

the caverne du pont - d ' arc in southern france contains 1 , 000 painstakingly - reproduced drawings as well as around 450 bones and other features .  it is the oldest known and best preserved cave decorated by man , but is not open to the public to keep the precious works of art safe .  the original and unique ‘ grotte chauvet ’ was discovered around 20 years ago and is a unesco world heritage site .

new information from nasa ' s mars rover curiosity shows that it is possible that there is liquid water close to the surface of the red planet .  very fine - grained sediments , which slowly fell down through the water , were deposited right at the bottom of the crater lake .  the explanation is that the substance perchlorate has been found in the soil , which reduces the freezing point so the water does not freeze into ice , but is liquid and present in very salty water .

researchers at lawrence berkeley national laboratory in california have spent nine years studying how to get the perfect shave .  they used x - ray beams to directly observe the microscopic changes that take place in skin to help it resist tearing during their stomach churning experiments .  they found that the curly fibers of collagen that make up dermis of the skin straighten and stretch in response to a tear to share the load and prevent further damage .

researchers looked at 477 anatomical features across 81 individual dinosaurs .  instead of the traditional method of plotting how similar each species is to the others , they instead used a ' specimen - based protocol ' .  this meant they could analyse each individual animal , despite its species , and allowed them to look at differences within each species , as well as between different species .

spanish researchers say climate change impacted human migration .  until 1 . 4 million years ago it was too cold to inhabit southeast spain .  but then the climate warmed to 13°c ( 55°f ) and became more humid .  this enabled hominins - our distant ancestors - to move to new regions .

tokyo researchers have proposed a laser system to attach to the iss .  it would be used to shoot down pieces of debris in earth orbit .  the system would have a range of 62 miles ( 100km ) and could target things less than 0 . 4 inches ( 1cm ) in size .

unique event happened in an ancient cluster of stars at the edge of the milky way galaxy .  when a star reaches its white dwarf stage , nearly all of the material from the star is packed inside a radius one hundredth that of the original star .  this means that , for close encounters , the gravitational pull of the star and the associated tides , are greatly enhanced .

thousands of bacteria colonies were discovered on banknotes and coins .  the money was collected from students at the university of surrey .  it was then submerged in agar - a substance that allows bacteria to grow quickly .  the most common type of bacteria they discovered living on our coinage was bacillus mycoides , which is common in soil , suggesting that someone was gardening before handling cash .

the rare mammal has been making waves at the taiji whale museum in southern japan .  while bottlenose dolphins are typically grey , the mammal is completely white – apart from the quirky tendency to turn pink when it ' s feeling emotional .  the phenomenon results from the animals thin skin , which means its blood vessels can cause a change in skin tone depending on their emotional state .

uk researchers studied the asteroid impact 66 million years ago .  they found the heat near the impact site in mexico was not intense enough to ignite plant material .  a heat pulse lasted less than a minute , too short to set plants alight .  impact site is believed to be the 125 mile ( 200km ) wide chicxulub crater buried underneath the yucatan peninsula in mexico .

nasa has been testing a flexible wing on a plane in california .  the wing can bend from - 2 degrees up to 30 degrees .  it means that regular flaps aren ' t needed - and it is much lighter .  in this image , the technology is visible at the flat ' flap at the base of the wing ' .  technology could increase fuel efficiency up to 12 per cent , and reduce noise at take - off and landing up to 40 per cent .

the black book of carmarthen is the earliest surviving medieval manuscript written solely in welsh , and contains some of the earliest references to arthur and merlin .  using a combination of ultraviolet light and photo editing software , the images were recovered .  the book is a collection of 9th - 12th century poetry along both religious and secular lines , and draws on the traditions of the welsh folk - heroes and legends of the dark ages .

scientists at brandeis university in massachusetts believe all - nighters to cram before an exam won ' t work because the process converting short - term memories to long - term memory is best carried out when a person is asleep .  studies have shown that sleep , memory and learning are deeply connected .  most animals , from flies to humans , have trouble remembering when they are sleep - deprived .
ronald reagan met mikhail gorbachev for the first time at a peace summit in geneva , switzerland in the 1980s and asked for his support in the event of an alien invasion .  reagan repeated the warning when he spoke to a group of students , and his speeches were examined by his advisers to remove any mention of aliens in them .  the warning was revealed in a book about ufos by dr david clarke , which examines the extent to which americans believed in stories about aliens .

a report suggests that carbon dioxide produced by burning fossil fuels could be captured and used to produce the fizz in cola .  ccs refers to the process of capturing carbon released by burning .  fossil fuels and storing it in porous rock layers in areas such as depleted oil and gas reservoirs .  the technology has the potential to reduce the emissions of a typical coal - power plant by up to 90 per cent , but there are concerns over storing such huge amounts of carbon underground .

qasr al - farid or ' the lonely castle ' is located in the northwestern region of the arabian peninsula .  it is located on a pre - islamic archaeological site located in al - ula , in the middle of a vast desert landscape .  the tomb is the largest of the 131 monumental tombs , which were carved straight into rock in the city of mada ' in saleh .  unesco declared the historic collection saudi arabia ' s first world heritage site in 2008 .

researchers based at different institutions in tokyo noted that rats flatten their ears , narrow their eyes and puff up their cheeks when they are in pain .  they found that long - evans rats can read pain on other animal ’ s faces and use the information to makes decisions .  the scientists wanted to find out whether the rodents do this as a reflex reaction , or to communicate their discomfort to others .

chlorine gas — carried by favourable winds over flanders fields from german positions - was used for the first time on april 22 , 1915 .  some 1 , 200 french soldiers were killed in the chaos of that five - minute gas attack .  chief of general staff erich von falkenhayn decided they would use the gas the next day or not at all .  on tuesday the organisation for the prohibition of chemical weapons will hold a commemorative meeting close to the fields .

the planetary society analysed the feasibility and cost of a crewed mission to orbit the martian moon phobos in 2033 .  it concluded that such a plan could indeed fit within nasa ' s human space exploration budget - but that politics is holding the decision back .  crewmembers would be able to study mars ' other moon , and potentially teleoperate rovers on the martian surface .

a stunning fireball that crackled across the sky last year shared its orbit with a huge asteroid found in october .  the study claims the kola fireball had a ' disturbingly similar ' path to asteroid 2014 ur116 .  this led researchers to the annama meteorite , which is an ordinary h5 chondrite - a group of space rocks with high strength that make up 31 per cent of meteorite falls .

by scanning the brains of people reading passages from the collection , researchers discovered ' arousing words ' affected parts of the brain concerned with emotion .  the emotional potential of words is rated in terms of valence and arousal ratings .  valence refers to how positive or negative a word is , while arousal refers to its ' physiological intensity ' .

the liquid is called shear - thickening fluid ( stf ) and instantly hardens upon impact at any temperature .  it does not conform to the model of newtonian liquids , such as water , in which the force required to move the fluid faster must increase exponentially .
